WorkItem.Description:
It seems like my Rawr will not allow it to go over that amount, but on elitestjerks it talks about how 102.4% is the magic number for dodge + parry + mastery + base 5% to get to.
Â 
Protection Paladin

Comments.Message: There's (obviously) really no such thing as 102.4% avoidance. 102.4% is the total you need to see on your character sheet in order to be unhittable by a boss. That's because bosses bypass 0.6% of each avoidance type. The %s you see in Rawr are real avoidance rates. Thus, you are unhittable when they total up to 100%.

Should i tell the person at the link below to maybe explain that a little better? I understand why 100% makes more sense, i was just setting my rawr to 102.4 because of that guide, but now i'll set it for 100 instead, thanks

http://elitistjerks.com/f76/t110338-cataclysm_tanking_protection_field_manual_updated_feb_9_2011_4_0_6_a/
No, because WoW's ratings are vs. a level 85 target, and thus you really do need 102.4% when looking at dodge/parry/block in game.  Rawr defaults to a level 88 target, so you only need 100% in Rawr.
